name: CuratorBOT
summary: CuratorBOT is one of my own full scale project, and an opportunity to practice creating a service or a product. I am making from sketch to the final product and it is really interesting to realize how much designing needs to do for the actual coding, because without it I will not be as effective as I want.

name: Image Gallery using Harvard API
summary: A group project made with two of my fellow student. Fetching data from an API always seems like something unimaginable and a mistery. Diving through the poorly done documentation sometimes ends up with dissapointment. The key is to understand and memorize the protocol of fetching data and the code itself, what needs a lot of practices... but what makes someone a master of something if it is not practicing (?)

name: Pizza Order App Prototype
summary: Originally the Pizza Ordering Application was a group project during the course, but I decided to do it again for a better understanding of the communication between back- and front end. Prepearing the data for the server is a difficult task, but it is necessary to memorize for further projects.

name: Image Gallery
summary: This was my first successful and solo course project what I have done all by myself. I am very happy for this achievements, because I learnt so much of it. Building up a server side communication for a front-end developer is not priority, but it could be a valueable skill for the future. Understanding the image uploading functionality of Node was an important lesson.
